post_text: Steve is thrilled to be joining TES as one of our EC teachers. Coming to us with a breadth of experience in education, he started his teaching career in New York State. There he taught for 25 years as a music educator, bringing distinction to the instrumental music departments of two school districts, guest conducted numerous festivals and adjudicated for the New York State School Music Association. In 2007, he left the classroom to work in higher ed. development after completing a second masters degree in communications. For the next twelve years, Steve assisted in achieving fundraising and engagement goals for private universities in New York, Pennsylvania and North Carolina. Steve came to TES as a substitute teacher last year and was asked to step in to teach math and science to our 5th graders. It was during this time that Steve became a part of the TES community and regained his love for being in a classroom. Steve lives in Gibsonville with his fiancée and dog, Cooper, and runs a small portrait photography business on the side.

post_text: BREAKING NEWS, Explorers! Huge congratulations are in order for 8th grade teachers Sara Riek and Kirsten Alderdice, who were informed today that they are this year’s recipient of North Carolina Middle Level Education's “TEAM TO WATCH” AWARD!!! This is a great example of the Project Based Learning model here at TES!

Students then compared what they found to regulations such as Building Code and the Americans with Disabilities Act. They presented their results to TES Director of Operations Patricia Brummitt.
